intro: Podolepis rosea, commonly known as the rose-flowered podolepis, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features delicate, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or rose-colored. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Podolepis rosea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
